title: Out-of-control wildfires cause evacuations in western Canada
description: Fire crews are battling wildfires threatening communities in western Canada amid hopes that cooler temperatures and the possibility of rain might bring some temporary relief

title: Deaths from Congo floods approach 400 as search continues
description: A local official in eastern Congo says the death toll from recent floods has nearly doubled to almost 400 people, The administrator of the Kalehe territory of South Kivu province told The Associated Press by phone that more bodies were recovered Sunday, including many found floating in Lake Kivu

title: Iran hid weapons among earthquake aid to target U.S. troops, leak says
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Iran and its affiliates moved swiftly to capitalize on the February earthquake that left tens of thousands dead, U.S. intelligence alleges.

title: Alleged killer of prominent Iraqi analyst sentenced to death
description: An Iraqi court has issued a death sentence against the alleged killer of prominent Iraqi security analyst Hisham al-Hashimi, nearly three years after his assassination

title: Israel readies ‘kosher electricity’ for ultra-Orthodox households
description: The special program would construct massive battery banks in and around Heradi communities to provide them power without violating Sabbath restrictions.

title: Brazil's Amazon megaprojects threaten Lula's green ambitions
description: After his swearing-in ceremony earlier this year, Brazil’s President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva walked up the ramp to the presidential palace arm in arm with one of the world’s most famous Indigenous leaders

title: 'Big lunch' follows big coronation celebrating King Charles
description: The long weekend to commemorate the coronation of King Charles III is continuing with picnics and street parties held across the U.K. in his honor

title: Rights groups condemn ‘alarming’ police arrests of coronation protesters
description: “These are scenes you’d expect to see in Russia not the UK,” tweeted the U.K. director of Human Rights Watch.

title: Czech opera singer Soňa Červená dies at age 97
description: Czech opera singer Soňa Červená has died at age 97

title: A caste survey in India could upend politics in world’s largest democracy
description: The Indian state Bihar has taken a historic step in surveying its castes, and the resulting data could fragment the national voter coalition of the governing Bharatiya Janata Party.

title: Arab League poised to vote on restoring Syria membership
description: Foreign ministers from Arab League member states in Cairo are poised to vote on restoring Syria’s membership to the organization after it was suspended over a decade ago

title: Japanese prime minister visits Seoul, resuming ‘shuttle diplomacy’
description: Fumio Kishida is visiting his South Korean counterpart, Yoon Suk Yeol, in the latest in a series of efforts to thaw relations between the neighbors.

title: Israel releases Jordan lawmaker said to have smuggled guns
description: Israel’s Shin Bet security agency says Israeli authorities have released a Jordanian lawmaker to his home country after he allegedly tried smuggling dozens of rifles and handguns through an Israeli-controlled border crossing

title: 12 killed in multi-vehicle crash in Turkey's Hatay province
description: Turkish officials say that 12 people have been killed and 31 others injured in a multi-vehicle crash in southern Turkey’s Hatay province

title: Satellite images show tankers Iran seized off Bandar Abbas
description: Satellite images analyzed by The Associated Press show two oil tankers recently seized by Iran off the coast of one of its key port cities on the strategic Strait of Hormuz

title: Rallygoers in Pakistan kill man accused of blasphemy
description: Pakistani police say rallygoers for a political party have beaten to death a participant for allegedly making a blasphemous speech

title: From his kitchen table, Erdogan’s challenger gets his message out
description: Shut out of mainstream media ahead of Turkey's May 14 election, the main opposition candidate has put out videos online laying out his vision for a Turkey after Erdogan.

title: 20 Indonesian trafficking victims freed in Myanmar
description: Indonesian officials say they freed 20 of their nationals who were trafficked to Myanmar as part of a cyber scam, amid an increase in human trafficking cases in Southeast Asia

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kyiv celebrates as it claims to have downed Putin’s ‘invincible’ hypersonic missile
description: The apparent defense milestone over the skies of Kyiv comes as officials worry that their long planned counteroffensive may not live up to expectations.

title: How the democratic hopes of the Sudan Spring went so horribly wrong
description: Since the latest fighting exploded, Sudan’s citizens have been trying to identify the fateful juncture at which their nation turned off the democratic path.
